clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of the Targeted Screening of Type 2 Diabetes by Capillary Blood Glucose
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of the Targeted Screening of Type 2 Diabetes by Capillary Blood Glucose Compared to Current Screening in the Priority Health Area of Saint-Etienne and the Sainté Diabète Network.

lead_sponsor.agency: Centre Hospitalier Universitaire de Saint Etienne

clinical_study.source: Centre Hospitalier Universitaire de Saint Etienne

brief_summary.textblock:
Type 2 diabetes is the chronic disease with the most important development in France, and particularly in the Saint-Etienne area due to his specific population.
Different studies showed the interest of screening targeted on high risk population to reduce cardiovascular risks and mortality.
The current screening recommandation is an opportunist targeted screening on population older than 45 years with risk factors by a fasting glucose every 3 years, and a communautaire screening targeted on population older than 45 years suffering precarity with or without risk factors by capillary blood glucose or fasting glucose.
The objective of the Sainté Diabete network is to optimize the screening of diabetics, their follow-up and their treatments. Using a self-administered questionnaire during a medical visit could be a simple, cheap and efficient tool to detect diabetics as soon as possible.

primary_outcome.measure: Sensitivity of detection of type 2 diabetes
primary_outcome.description: To evaluate the sensitivity (true positive) of detection of type 2 diabetes by a self-administered questionnaire performed in a pharmacy or a hospital compared to capillary blood glucose measurements in the same population from the priority health area of Saint-Etienne.

secondary_outcome.measure: Specificity of detection of type 2 diabetes
secondary_outcome.description: To evaluate the specificity (true negative) of detection of type 2 diabetes by a self-administered questionnaire performed in a pharmacy or a hospital compared to capillary blood glucose measurements in the same population from the priority health area of Saint-Etienne

secondary_outcome.measure: To evaluate the cost of the targeted screening and the screening accessibility to population from the priority health area of Saint-Etienne
To evaluate the numbers of patients screened by self-administered questionnaire and diagnosed as diabetics using fasting glucose.

intervention.description: Patients viewed in a pharmacy or a hospital fulfill the self-administered questionnaire before having a capillary blood glucose measurement.

study_pop.textblock: Population is composed by patients living in the Saint-Etienne area, 45 years or older, not known as diabetics, and viewed in a pharmacy or a hospital.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Man or woman
- 45 years or older
- Signed informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- fasting glucose performed in the last 2 years
- diabetes history
- not living in Saint-Etienne

clinical_study.keyword: diabetes, capillary blood glucose, self-administered questionnaire
